main event: A civilian reported observing an unidentified flying object resembling a metal piece and claiming a loud explosion occurred in St. Georges de Beauce, P.Q. on June 16, 1964.
interesting points: The object was described as having a glass-like appearance and was about 40 feet in diameter., The witness stated that the object hovered for about a minute before moving away quickly., Following the explosion, pieces of dark, tar-like material were found at the supposed impact site., A lab analysis revealed that the object was likely from a lightning arrestor related to high-tension wires., This event led to multiple witness reports, all of whom corroborated the unusual behavior of the object.
sighted object: a large, glass-like unidentified flying object
location: St. Georges de Beauce, P.Q., Canada
witness description: Residents reported seeing and hearing an explosion with subsequent discovery of unusual materials.
